title: Coinbase | IC4 | Bengaluru
content:
Education: B.Tech in Computer Science
Years of Experience: 3.5 years
Date of the Offer: Feb 2025
Company: Coinbase
Title/Level: IC4
Location: Bangalore, India (Remote)
Fixed Salary: Rs. 47.5 L
Equity (RSUs) : $27,500
Vesting Schedule: 25% quarterly over a year
Bonus: Performance-based bonus up to 5% of salary every year - Rs. 2.2 L
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): Rs. 73.7 L

Interview experience : https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-question/6392076/coinbase-ic4-india-offer/2844879

title: Visa Inc | SW Engineer | 1.5 YOE | Suggestions needed
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier 3
Years of Experience: 1.5+
Current company: Product based 
Current Comp: 10 LPA (base) + Peanuts


Date of the Offer: Jan 2025
Company: Visa
Title/Level: SW Engineer
Location: india
Base: 14 LPA
Total comp: 16 L + Peanuts with no stock option


Other details: This is my first offer, and I didn't have anything to negotiate. I've already resigned—my current company was willing to match, but I declined as I wanted a fresh start. Do you think I should try during my notice period?

Reason for looking out:
I wasn’t getting any real learning opportunities, and the project was a complete mess—no testing, no code reviews, no best practices, and barely any time for testers (just one day for manual testing before production). This created a toxic work culture where fixing one bug often led to discovering more, due to the lack of proper testing. As a result, meeting committed timelines became nearly impossible. On top of that, I had to deal with incompetent coworkers.  

Would love to hear your thoughts!
salaryTotal: : 16 L + Peanuts With No Stock Option

title: Visa Offer | 1.5+ yoe |  Need Suggestions
content:
Education: B.Tech from Tier-3
Years of experience: 1.5+
Current company type: Product based
Current comp: 10 LPA (base) + peanuts

Date of the offer: Jan 2025
Company: Visa Inc.
Title/Level: SW Engineer
Location: India
Base Salary: ₹14,00,000
Total Compensation: ₹16 L + peanuts

This is my first offer, and I didn't have anything to negotiate. I've already resigned—my current company was willing to match, but I declined as I wanted a fresh start. Do you think I should explore opportunities during my notice period?  

Reason for looking out:
I wasn’t getting any real learning opportunities, and the project was a complete mess—no testing, no code reviews, no best practices, and barely any time for testers (just one day for manual testing before production). This created a toxic work culture where fixing one bug often led to discovering more, due to the lack of proper testing. As a result, meeting committed timelines became nearly impossible. On top of that, I had to deal with incompetent coworkers.  

Would love to hear your thoughts!
